chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order
Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian A Barwick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Computer Message-Threaten/Disclose ID [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(e).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Computer Message-Threaten/Disclose ID [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
EACH COUNT: Restitution is set at $0. 
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Concurrent with: concurrent to Count 2, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 21 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
- Absolutely no contact with S.M.,  R.B., and children unless granted by family court.
- Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

supervisions.notes:
- No contact with firearms.
- Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
- Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian A Barwick in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Brian A Barwick in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 years, concurrent to Count 2, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 21 days time served.  The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 year, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 year. 

As to Count 2:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 years, concurrent to Count 1, consecutive to any other sentence.  The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 year, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 year. 

As to Count 3:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 years, concurrent to Count 4, consecutive to Counts 1 and 2 and any other sentence.  The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 year, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 year. 

As to Count 4:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 years, concurrent to Count 3, consecutive to Counts 1 and 2 and any other sentence.  The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 year, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 year. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- Absolutely no contact with S.M.,  R.B., and children unless granted by family court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Restitutio is set at $0. 
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Brian A Barwick not in court, in custody.  Erika Motsch for Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  Case scheduled for sentencing hearing.  Defense motion to adjourn reviewed by Court.  Court grants one adjournment.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Adjourn, filed.
Order

Defendant Brian A Barwick in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Brian A Barwick in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Court finalizes instructions with parties.  Jury in box at 9:35 am.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court takes a break.  Jury out of box. 
 
Jury back in box.  Closing statements continued.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 12:04 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Donzelli and Terrell who were duly sworn for that purpose.  

At the hour of 3:14 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in verdicts of :

As to Count 1:  GUILTY, which was then read.
As to Count 2:  GUILTY, which was then read.
As to Count 3:  GUILTY, which was then read.
As to Count 4:  GUILTY, which was then read.

Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered defendant to be transported to Redgranit Correctional Institution. Order, signed and filed.

At the request of parties, Court ordered a presentence investigation without a recommendation.  Order for Presentence Investigation received and filed; copy to Probation Dept.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing to Br. 45.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Brian A Barwick in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Brian A Barwick in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Jury in box at 2:38 pm.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective Doreen Gordy.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 2:45 pm.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Defendant examined by the Court as to his right to remain silent and found defendant feely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to remain silent.  Defendant will testify.
Jury in the box at 3:00 pm.  Sworn for defense: Brian Barwick.   Jury out of box at 3:35 pm.  Jury in box at 3:57 pm.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court releases jury for the evening.  Court instructed jury.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.
  Jury trial scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian A Barwick in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Brian A Barwick in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Parties discussed motions and issues; rulings placed on the record.   
Jury in box at 10:19 am.  Sworn for the State.  MPD Police Officer James Fohr.  Exhibits 12-33 received.  Jurors release for the lunch hour.  Court instructed jury.  Jury out of box at 11:42 am.  Sidebars placed on the record.  Case adjourned to 2:00 pm.

Defendant Brian A Barwick in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Brian A Barwick in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Jury in box at 2:01 pm.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly sworn.  

Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Raeann B. Exhibit s 1,3 received; Exhibit 2 marked.  Jury out of box for break at 3:26 pm.  Jury back in box at 3:46 pm.  Continued testimony of Raeann B.  Exhibits 4-6 received.  Sworn for the State:  Kevin D.  Exhibits 7-11 received.  Court releases jury for the evening.  Jury out of box at 4:35 pm.  Sidebars placed on the record.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.

Defendant Brian A Barwick in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Brian A Barwick in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Court reviews instructions with parties.  Defendant examined by the Court as to his right to street clothes for trial and found defendant feely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to street clothes.  Discussions as to defendants testimony.  Courts rulings placed on the record.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  9:54 am.  Jury panel out of box at 11:36 am.  Court held additional voir dire with juror #2.  Juror #2 out of box.  Court held additional voir dire with juror #29.  Juror #29 out of box.  Jury panel back in box at 12:00 pm.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Case adjourned to 1:30 pm.  Jury out of box at 12:12 pm.  In-chambers discussion and strikes for cause placed on the record.

Defendant Brian A Barwick in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Brian A Barwick in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Both parties are ready to proceed. Case passed. Case recalled. In chambers discussions placed on the record. Court denies defense motion to sever cases. Court denies defense counsel's oral motion to suppress "other items" not mentioned in the search warrant. Court denies defense motion to adjourn jury trial. Defendant waives his right to have his notes produced from Red Granite Correctional Institution. Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 45.  Jury trial scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Brian A Barwick not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Defense withdraws motion to sever.  

Arguments heard as to admisability of items found in the search warrant.  Defense motion to exclude items denied by the Court.  Court takes judicial notice that defendant's last motion in limine, #16, should be #17.  

State's Other Acts Motion, argued and Granted by the Court.  

Parties proceed with Daubert Hearing.  Sworn for the State:  MPD Detective Doreen Gordy.  Parties rest.  Testimony closed.  Defense does not challenge credentials.  Detective Gordy will be allowed to testify.  

Case passed to produce defendant.  
Back on record.  Defendant in court, in custody.  

Arguments heard as to what the defendant can testify to.  Court places rulings on the record.

Parties prepared to proceed to trial.  Case remains scheduled for Jury Trial in Branch 45 at 8:30 am on 02-29-2016.

Defendant Brian A Barwick in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Brian A Barwick in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
In-chambers discussion placed on the record.  Court takes defense motion to sever and state's other acts motion under advisement.  Court orders case adjourned for Decision. 

Court makes rulings as to Motions in Limine.  Defense requests a Daubert hearing.  Case adjourned to branch 45 for Motion Hearing and Decision.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
State's Motion to Introduce Other Acts Evidence Pursuant to Wis. State. sec. 904.04, filed
Defendant's Motion to Seve, filed
State's Supplemented Motions in Limine, filed.
Notice of Expert Testimony

Defendant Brian A Barwick in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Brian A Barwick in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Report of Dr. Rawski is reviewed by all parties and there is no challenge to the report.  Based on reasonable degree of medical certainty the court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates all proceedings and previous bail.
The state had filed a Notice of Expert Testimony pertaining to IP addresses dated 12-17-2015 and defense counsel is now moving to adjourn trial of 1-11-2016 for time ot obtain a defense expert and also on the basis that the defendant had been held at the CJF for purposes of competency evalaution to be completed and all the defendant's paperwork is in his cell at RED GRANITE. 
The court will grant the adjournment of the trial.  The court will no longer accept any plea bargains or negotiations.    Case set for final pretrial/motions on 2-18-2016 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 2-29-2016 at 8:15am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:15 am.
DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO ADJOURN
Defendant is at REDGRANITE Correctional.  Court is directing that defendant is to be held in CJF to allow for Dr. Rawski to conduct competency examination---DO NOT SHIP

Defendant Brian A Barwick in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Brian A Barwick in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Proceedings are suspended.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Clerk contacted the Forensic Unit to ensure that examining doctor will be available for testimony, if needed, on the next court date of 1-7-2016 at 8:15.  Dr. Rawski will be available.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Brian A Barwick in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Nicholas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived preliminary hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Signed Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver signed and filed.  Court bound defendant over for trial.  Defense requests a Bail Motion Hearing to modify conditions of release.  Defense requests waiver of defendant's appearance for this hearing.  Court denies this request.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Dallet.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Flanagan, Br. 4.

Cash bail from 14CM5090 to apply.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Court will allow GPS release as follows: Celebrate Recovery from 6pm to 9pm, for counseling from 11am to 12pm every other Tuesday, one time release to Madison for computer assessment and download, and grocery shopping 1 hour/ 1 time per week. All appointments must be verified by Justice Point. Defendant to make no stops other than verified appointments. Court denied defense request to allow computer use by the defendant.  Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms.
